---
title: "China's trade with the Middle East and North Africa, 2000-2020"
output:
   html_document:
    number_sections: false
---

The ascent of China to superpower status is one of the most significant geopolitical development of the 21st century thus far.
China has increased its economic footprint in the Middle East and North Africa substantially since the turn of the century. 
In contrast, over the last decade, the US has began to shift its attention to the Indo-Pacific, increasingly stepping away from its traditional role 
as the region's security guarantor.
